meanings.definition: An antibody that causes agglutination of red blood cells from another individual of the same species.
meanings.sent1: The isoagglutinin reacted with the red blood cells, causing them to clump together.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use isoagglutinins to determine blood compatibility for transfusions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous isoagglutinin decided to play a game of red blood cell dominoes.
meanings.sent4: The isoagglutinin acted like a magnet, pulling the red blood cells closer and closer.
meanings.sent5: In the body, isoagglutinins act as little detectives, identifying foreign red blood cells.

meanings.definition: A substance that agglutinates red blood cells from a different individual of the same species.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician added the isoagglutinin to the sample, observing the red blood cells clumping.
meanings.sent2: Isoagglutinins are important in blood typing procedures.
meanings.sent3: The isoagglutinin threw a party for the red blood cells, causing them to stick together.
meanings.sent4: The isoagglutinin functioned like a glue, binding the red blood cells tightly.
meanings.sent5: When present, isoagglutinins help identify incompatible blood for transfusions.
